prompt.text: What's a small act of kindness someone did for you that you still remember?

comments.text: Small acts of kindness create lasting impressions and strengthen our connections with others. These gestures remind us of the inherent goodness in people and inspire us to pay it forward.
A stranger paid for my coffee when I forgot my wallet. It was like $4. I cried in my car. I was going through a divorce and it just... hit different.
Bus driver waited for me when he saw me running. I was late for an interview. Got the job. That man changed my whole career trajectory by waiting 10 seconds.
A professor wrote a personal note on my essay when I was struggling. Just "I see you're trying. Don't give up." I still have that paper 15 years later.
an old lady in a parking lot told me i had pretty eyes. unprompted. just walked up and said it and walked away. i think about it every time i feel ugly

aiTells: Doesn't share any specific kindness received
humanTells: #3: Specific outcome (got the job), time detail
explanation.difficulty_note: Easy - AI philosophizes about kindness while humans share specific moments

prompt.text: What's a video game that you think everyone should play at least once?

comments.text: Portal 2. Perfect balance of puzzle, story, and comedy. Even non-gamers can get into it. I've made my entire family play it.
Video games offer unique interactive experiences that can be enjoyed by people of all backgrounds. The right game can introduce new players to the joys of gaming as a medium.
Undertale. You can play it in an afternoon and it'll make you think about video game morality in ways you never have before. Plus the soundtrack slaps.
minecraft. it's basically digital legos with survival elements. there's no wrong way to play. my 6 year old nephew and my 60 year old dad both love it
Celeste. Challenging platformer with an incredibly sincere story about mental health. The assist mode means anyone can actually finish it regardless of skill.

aiTells: "Joys of gaming as a medium" - sounds like an essay
Talks about gaming generally instead of answering
humanTells: #3: Time estimate, specific impact, soundtrack praise
#4: Specific analogy, family examples with ages
#5: Genre + theme described, accessibility feature noted
explanation.difficulty_note: Medium - AI evangelizes gaming without naming a game

prompt.text: What's a cheap food you'll never be too good for?

comments.text: Kraft mac and cheese. I have a six-figure salary. I still make the blue box at 2am. Some things transcend income brackets.
instant ramen but i elevate it with an egg and some green onions. is it fancy? no. do i eat it twice a week minimum? yes. will i ever stop? also no.
affordable food options can be just as satisfying as expensive alternatives. there's no need to feel embarrassed about enjoying budget-friendly meals that provide comfort and nutrition
Gas station hot dogs. I know where they've been (the roller for possibly days). I don't care. 7-Eleven big bite, extra mustard, no regrets.
taco bell. i've eaten at actual mexican restaurants. i've been to mexico. i still want a cheesy gordita crunch at midnight. this is non-negotiable

aiTells: "No need to feel embarrassed" - reassurance statement
"Budget-friendly meals" - sounds like a finance article
Doesn't name any specific cheap food
humanTells: #1: Salary contrast, specific time and brand
explanation.difficulty_note: Hard - AI defends cheap food concept without naming favorites

prompt.text: What's something you've changed your mind about as you've gotten older?

comments.text: Naps. Absolute waste of time as a kid. Now? A weekend nap is basically a religious experience. I schedule them. I protect them.
My parents. Thought they were clueless. Now I realize they were just exhausted humans doing their best. Called my mom to apologize last year.
as we age and accumulate life experiences, our perspectives naturally evolve. changing our minds about previously held beliefs is a sign of growth and intellectual maturity
Staying home on weekends. Used to think it was boring. Now it's the entire goal. Friday night in pajamas by 7pm is peak existence.
therapy. thought it was for "other people." turns out everyone could use someone to talk to. biggest waste of time was the years i spent avoiding it

aiTells: Doesn't share any specific changed opinion
explanation.difficulty_note: Expert - AI philosophizes about growth without sharing personal change
